Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (76.47%) toTachyplesin IIK: 29%; C: 24%; Y: 12%.Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 4.0 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 2.0 ug/ml), K. pneumonia (MIC 4.0 ug/ml), E. faecium (MIC 2.0 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 1.0 ug/ml), and C. acnes (MIC 2.0 ug/ml). Also active against fungi C. albicans Y-326 or Y-6359 (MIC 8-16 ug/ml),  C. parapsilosis Y-1761 or Y-1763 (MIC 2-32 ug/ml), C. krusei Y-27803 or Y-27825 (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), A. fumigatus 9648 or 9651 (MIC 64 ug/ml), A. flavus MYA-3651 or MYA-1004 (MIC 64 ug/ml), A. corymbifera NRRL 6251 (MIC2 ug/ml), F. solani NRRL 28548 (MIC 2 ug/ml), M. circinelloides NRRL 3631 (MIC 64 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Woodburn KW, Jaynes J, Clemens LE. 2020
Literature Information.Title: Designed Antimicrobial Peptides for Topical Treatment of Antibiotic Resistant Acne Vulgaris.
